page.title: 03 Yew Tree Farm
page.content: This rented arable farm of 400 acres is named after a still living,1000 year old Yew Tree. The farmhouse dates from the 1850's & there is a traditional barn. The clay soil supports 200 acres of wheat & less amounts of rape, barley & oats. 25 acres are kept as permanent grassland. Rabbits & pigeons are a big nuisance causing much damage. The livestock consists mainly of sheep- 350 ewes & 620 lambs. After birth the lambs are kept in the barn for 48 hours before going outside. This is usually between mid-March & the first week in April. There are 3 pet pigs with 9 piglets. There are two tractors worth 18,000 pounds & a new combine worth 50,000 pounds. The wheels are interchangeable, e.g. narrow wheels allow crop spraying without damage.
